intro: Swainsona coronillifolia var. alboviolacea, commonly known as the white-violaceo swainsona, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has a shallow root system and is adapted to arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native range. Its flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
